derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Malay gong, gung, of imitative origin

entry.def: A gong is a large, flat, circular piece of metal that you hit with a hammer to make a sound like a loud bell. Gongs are sometimes used as musical instruments, or to give a signal that it is time to do something.

example.ex: On the stroke of seven, a gong summons guests into the dining-room.
example.tran: 7点整时一阵锣声将客人召集到餐厅。

entry.def: People sometimes refer to a medal or an award as a gong .

example.ex: Spike Milligan has finally got the gong he had been promised.
example.tran: 斯派克·米利根最终拿到了早就承诺给他的那块奖章。
贵族头衔、爵士称号以及其他各种勋章

means.word_mean: 1. a percussion instrument consisting of a metal plate that is struck with a soft-headed drumstick
2. a percussion instrument consisting of vertical metal tubes of different lengths that are struck with a hammer

sentences.en: His music is a haunting mix of guitar, synthesizer, oriental gongs and bells.
